title: Spinal Injury
summary: Critical first aid for suspected spinal injuries. Focus on preventing movement and maintaining airway while awaiting emergency services.

steps.title: Do Not Move - Call 911
steps.description: Do NOT move the person unless in immediate danger (fire, drowning). Call 911 immediately. Assume spinal injury after any serious trauma, fall from height, or vehicle accident.

steps.title: Stabilize Head and Neck
steps.description: Kneel behind the person's head. Place your hands on both sides of their head with fingers spread. Hold the head in line with the spine in the position found. Do not twist or bend.

steps.title: Maintain Airway if Needed
steps.description: If person is unconscious and not breathing, use jaw thrust maneuver instead of head tilt. Place fingers behind angle of jaw and lift forward without moving neck. Begin rescue breathing if trained.

steps.title: Immobilize the Body
steps.description: If others are available, have them place rolled towels, blankets, or clothing on both sides of the body to prevent movement. Continue holding the head steady. Do not use a cervical collar unless trained.

steps.title: Monitor Vital Signs
steps.description: Check breathing and consciousness regularly. Note any loss of sensation or movement in limbs. Keep person warm. Continue stabilization until paramedics arrive and take over.

warnings: Any movement can cause permanent paralysis or death
Never move someone with suspected spinal injury unless life is in immediate danger
Do not remove helmets unless absolutely necessary for airway access
whenToSeekHelp: Call 911 immediately for all suspected spinal injuries
Never attempt to transport someone with spinal injury yourself
Multiple trained responders are needed for safe movement
preventionTips: Always wear seatbelts and use proper car seats
Never dive into unknown or shallow water
Use proper technique when lifting heavy objects
